sentences.sContent: Toohey is the exception: he is the one character in Rand's work who fully comprehends the difference between good and evil, between individualism and collectivism, and consciously chooses evil.
sentences.sContent_eng: Toohey is the exception: he is the one character in Rand's work who fully comprehends the difference between good and evil, between individualism and collectivism, and consciously chooses evil.
sentences.sCn: 图希是个例外：他是兰德作品里一个彻底理解善与恶的区别，个人主义与集体主义的区别，并刻意选择为恶的角色。

sentences.sContent: "Smaller countries tend to be a little happier because there is a stronger sense of collectivism and then you also have the aesthetic qualities of a country, " White said.
sentences.sContent_eng: "Smaller countries tend to be a little happier because there is a stronger sense of collectivism and then you also have the aesthetic qualities of a country, " White said.
sentences.sCn: 怀特指出：“小国家的人民有更加幸福的趋势，因为这些国家的人有更强烈的集体主义感，以至于他们会注意到这个国家的优势。”

words.tran: 集体的；共同的；集合的；集体主义的
可收集的；可回收的（等于collectable）
收集成地；冷静地，镇定地
采集，聚集；[税收] 征收；收藏品；募捐
收藏家；[电子] 集电极；收税员；征收者
集团化；使集体化；使之成为共同的（等于collectivise）

trans.tranOther: a political system in which all businesses, farms etc are owned by the government
